info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 12 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Berks and northwestern Montgomery Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Spring Ridge, or near Reading, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Reading, Pottstown, Wyomissing, Birdsboro, Fleetwood, Sinking Spring, Laureldale, Wernersville, Leesport, Bally, Bechtelsville, Spring Ridge, Fairview Hgts, Gilbertsville, Stowe, Shillington, West Reading, Boyertown, Mount Penn and Mohnton. This includes Interstate 176 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 10 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
